transportAdvice: Paros has a local bus network connecting the main towns and popular beaches, though services can be infrequent outside peak season; renting a scooter, ATV, or car is the most practical way to explore the island. Taxis are available but limited in number, and the main town of Parikia is walkable for those staying centrally.

weather.description: Cool and quiet winter month with occasional rain and few tourists; most businesses are closed.
Similar to January, mild but unsettled with periodic showers and a very subdued atmosphere.
Early spring brings slightly warmer days and occasional sunshine, though rain is still possible.
Pleasant spring weather with warm sunny days and cool evenings; a good time for sightseeing before crowds arrive.
Warm and increasingly sunny with very little rain; ideal conditions for exploring and early beach visits.
Hot and reliably sunny with the Meltemi winds beginning to pick up, keeping temperatures comfortable.
Peak summer heat with strong Meltemi winds and very dry conditions; beaches and nightlife are at their busiest.
The hottest and most crowded month; expect full beaches, lively nightlife, and persistent northerly winds.
Warm and sunny with crowds thinning toward the end of the month; excellent conditions for swimming and dining outdoors.
Mild autumn temperatures with occasional showers; a relaxed and affordable time to visit with fewer tourists.
Noticeably cooler and wetter with many seasonal businesses closing; a quiet, off-season feel across the island.
Cool winter month with rain likely and most tourist facilities closed; the island returns to a local pace of life.
